Side Effects: tingly sensations at the ends of my fingers _  pins and needles are 10 times worse when ya get them in the feet _ brain fog _ confusion _ Pee a lot . Pain in shoulder _feels like muscle fatigue _ I think its related _ but doc don't .
Comments: Diamox _ been on these 4 years _ cases where rare back then . Told rare for a man _ I'm not obese either . I don't get head aches or any kind of discomfort in the head. I need to come of these as I think these are causing joint pain in my right shoulder_ but docs say its a frozen shoulder .

Side Effects: Increase Dizziness_ Tingling hands feet_ skin felt crawly_ nausea_ brain fog_ easily confused_ tired_ tired_ tired
Comments: In my case I do not recommend taking this for Meniere's Disease. It made all the symptoms worse!! And it's been 3 months since I stopped taking it and the side effects are still happening. It's taken a problem and tripled it.  It has really made my life unbearable. I was an active motivated_ clear minded person and now I'm just lost in this fog of confusions and feel stupid and useless. It has destroyed what was left of my life and self esteem and am just praying that the side effects will go away. No one told me that this could happen and no one seems to care enough to listen ~ I am not imagining this and I know what happened and when things got so bad... be very careful with this medication ~ it may work for some people_ but for the rest of us it has destroyed our lives... Thank you to everyone for their reviews_ I've been lost and don't wish it on anyone_ but it's good to know that I'm not "just imagining it."

Side Effects: funny taste of diet coke..restless sleep cannot seen to stay asleep and feel tired all the time

Some dizziness. Subsided after first month. Ringing in hands_ legs_ and feet. Feet tingling still awakes me at night. Exhausted most of the time. And always feel cold. Dry hair and mouth. Soda has tasted metallic since day dosage started; however after a month all food began to taste like cardboard. Loss of breath with little exertion_ almost feels like hyperventilation. Fogginess of thought is frustrating. Despite seldom having a meal_ have not lost much weight on this medicine.
Comments: This drug_ along with effective lumbar puncture_ has saved my vision_ which was in great danger with CSF pressure of 570. The side effects are bothersome_ but seem minimal when alternative is considered. When I miss a dose_ it's noticeable. My eye aches_ ear whooshing begins again_ and headache starts to sneak in. So it is working.

Side Effects: I am still on this drug but I hate it_ I am constantly tired and get extremely slow and confused where I feel thick and ditsy and that is not me. I have had severe joint pain which seems to be getting worse from day 1 and my neurologist has brushed it off and believes that it is nothing to do with Diamox_ I've been referred to several joint consultants and none of them can tell me why I'm getting these pains. I feel as if my body is weak and I also tend to get a tight head and random blurry vision which can last for 20 minutes then go back to normal. My libido has also gone completely.
Tingling on hands feet spider gave sensation on face. Lost of appetite and headaches. Blurry vision and makes me feel so tired. But has help me with my papilledema.
Loss of appetite/weight loss_ carbonated drinks taste terrible_ caffeine exacerbates pressure_ frequent urination due to increased water intake_ headaches_ occasional tingling in hands and feet.

Tingling in hands/feet. I am cold all the time. The initial side effects of taste issues went away. I have joint pain- knees especially and I have no grip in  my hands at times. I do struggle with fatigue off and on. Foggy brain and inability to focus at times.  I am now wondering if this med is what is killing my libido??
Comments: It is a relief to find this page. I felt like I was going crazy at times. I am not that old yet I can't remember things and my quick wit seems to be going rapidly:( I thought I had an undetected autoimmune issue but after reading all these posts- I think the joint issues are b/c of this med. I am now experiencing decreased libido for the last year or so and am wondering if this med is why. I did go off of it for 5 days and ended up with an rare form of migraine that mimics a seizure and was hospitalized. Clearly the side effects are worth it. That was very scary!

Side Effects: Tingling and numbness in hands_ feet_ lower legs_ and lower half of face. Some indigestion and heartburn at the beginning and when dose was increased.
Comments: The drug is saving my sight. When the PTC kicked in with the headaches_ vertigo_ horrible tinnitus_ dizziness_ vomiting_ nausea_ I wasn't paying much attention to my sight at first. When I did...I was shocked at how blurry and difficult it was to focus. I was diagnosed with secondary glaucoma do to the pressure_ and had already lost some vision. The Diamox was increased_ and eye drops added to the long list of medications and no further damage to my sight has occurred. As much as I dislike the tingling_ the numbness_ and it increases whenever the dose is increased_ I won't go off until the PTC is resolved. That unfortunately hasn't shown any sign of happening.

Side Effects: Taking for iih - Tiredness dizzy_ head ache on occasion_ pins n needles r the worst keep me up at night I am taking 1000mg 2 twice a day have no appetite feel sick most days... I suffer massively with anxiety so not having he best time with these!
Comments: I feel they are working as my lights spots in my eyes are much better I am still experiencing headaches but think that is the meds not the iih its a different headache so I'm sticking with it still don't know why I have it if it's weight related I hopefully won't have to be on them for a long distance as I am losing weight!

Side Effects: Tingling (Lips and feet)_ Heart Burn_ Acid Reflux_ Fatigue
Comments: Diagnosed with PTC. Constant headaches for a year. Noticed when I was a child I couldn't wear headbands or pull my hair back to tight_ car sickness when traveling to the mountains. I have been headache free for 4 days! I'll take the side effects.

Side Effects: Tingling in fingers and toes_ fatigue_dry mouth_ loss of appetite. frequent urination. diarrhea_ cramping_ joint pain
Comments: I was diagnosed with Psuedotumor 2months ago. About a month before I was having severe headaches that had me screaming and in tears. I had to stay in complete darkness and everyone had to speak in a whisper because light and sound triggered the headache. I thought I had a brain tumor or an aneurysm. Drs. said it was just migraines and that they were normal for a woman in her first trimester. A couple weeks later I was back in the hospital because my double vision had greatly increased and my right eye stopped moving. A new Dr. finally diagnosed me with pseudotumor and started me on Diamox. It is true that the side effects can be horrible. I started out taking 1_000mg and was increased to 2_000mg after my opthamologist noticed that my optic nerve swelling hadn't gone down. However_ I have read that it may take time to find out what dosage may be right for the individual. Also_ my headaches and the pressure I was feeling at the beginning haven't returned. The pressure that I felt in my head is mild and the headaches can be controlled with tylenol. My eye also started to move again. Alot of the side effects also died down. As a reminder_ you have to make sure you take in potassium and drink lots of water!!! The disorder is still difficult for me_ especially since I'm pregnant. But I try to remind myself that every cure or treatment is going to come with side effects and what will happen if I stop taking it.

Side Effects: Low energy_ tingling in hands pain in shoulders and arms. Dry mouth_ diarrhea.
Comments: Diamox does work for my pseudotumor but side effects can be a bit harsh. I recommend it.

Side Effects: upset stomach_ altered taste of food and drinks_ lethargy_ metallic taste in mouth_ headaches_ tingling in feet_ hands and face
Comments: I am taking this to reduce the pressure and fluid in my head caused by superior semicircular canal dehiscence on my right side_ and thinning on my left side.  There has been some relief_ but it isn't consistent and there is still pressure_ and a feeling of my ears being stopped up_ as well as the same pain associated with decreasing altitude (as if descending in a plane).

Side Effects: Memory loss.balance losing had to hospitalised as could not stand properly .Nero physicians attended and was advised for surgery .even got  l.p. done.even after 10 days over I do not get my taste and yet not feeling wellplease advice what is to be done.???????????
Comments: Will request scientific to find alternate of it.

Side Effects: Tingling in fingers_ fatigue_ really thirsty_ forgetful/short term memory loss_ mind fogginess?/mental slowness I guess_ stomach aches_ felt very bad_ loss of appetite
Comments: I lost 12 pounds while on diamox (I still am) because of loss of appetite_ the whole time I've been on it ive felt mentally slow or mentally foggy_ I've been drinking about a gallon of water a day. Still on it_ the basic bad feeling hasn't been as bad but I've been out of school and unable to really do much :-( I really think it did and is helping though.

Side Effects: Dry mouth_ cloudy urine_ diarrhea_ tingling in hands and feet.  Forgetfulness_ confusion_ I'm really tired all the time.  Sensitive to sun light_ my skin hurts once in awhile like a bad sun burn.  Lose of weight.
Comments: I've been on this medicine for a long time just recently they tried to take me off of it and pressure went up.  Sad to say I'm back on the medicine.  For thoughs of you who legs are cramping you are lacking potassium eat more bananas or take it in pill form.  Also just met with a specialist and there is a new surgery that has been successful for those of us who can't function normally on this medicine its brain stenting.  I  have been meeting with a specialist to see if this is right for me.  My advice is to stay on the medicine it gets better.  Look at all you options.

Side Effects: Tingling in lip_fingers and toes_cloudy frequent urination. Confused forgetful_constipation_ weight loss_ change in taste buds
Comments: The medicine work great for the headaches_flashes floaters and ringing in my ears

Side Effects: Tingling in hands_ feet_ and lips. Very tired and exahausted all the time. Mind is foggy and I get confused easily and much more forgetful. Extreme heartburn. Pop and beer tastes terrible. Ear ringing. Bad neck pain/soreness. Cloudy urine. Frequent urination. Headaches are gone and vision has improved. Just wish I could function normally.

When I first started taking Diamox_ the first 2 weeks were unbearable and my dose increased to 2000MG per day_ and was reduced to 1000MG because I couldnt handle the side effects. Continual cramping in legs and feet especially at night_ wakes me up about 6 times per night and the painful cramping lasted 20 minutes each episode. Pins and needles in lips_ feet and arms all day. Continual ringing in ears that I couldnt have a conversation or go to work. Tired all the time_ loss of appetite.
Comments: Lost 10 kg (22 pounds) since starting this medication due to loss of appetite. Still get the cramping in my legs but magnesium tablets seem to help as well as drinking lots of water. Slowly starting to regain my energy levels and feeling less tired. Have had 6 appoints with the neuro since and my optic nerves swelling have reduced as well as the intracranial pressure. Scheduled in for another lumbar puncture soon. My  vision hasn't improved but has actually deteriorated slightly_ but the headaches have completely stoped.

Side Effects: My symptomes are the same as everyone else on here_ the food_ the soda_ the weight loss_ trouble sleeping... I feel like a walking talking side effect! LolI am extreme in these few other things... I am extremely sensitive to light_ i wear special tinted glasses indoors to block out light. Numbness and tingling in hands and feet goes up my arms and legs if I get cold even when it's warm out. I have a hard time regulating my temperature so I am cold often. I have ringing in my ears like my head is in a washing machine_ there are times i lose my hearing. I have a sound sensitivity and I wear special ear plugs. I tire easily. My mood changes. I am starting to losing my hair. With all that said I recommend Diamox to all who truly have IIH! It Changed my life by making mine manageable again. These side effects are no picnic but they are a drop in the bucket to what I was suffering with before this medication. I've read some of the posts and it is sad that so many people gave up on this medicine after only a few weeks. It took me a month and a few LPs to get feeling like I was moving in the right direction.

PTC manifested by loud pulsations in ear for 13 years and persistent vertigo for one year. Finally diagnosed 8 months ago. After beginning Diamox: frequent tingling in fingers and toes_ severe nausea_ loss of appetite_ lethargy and cloudy urine. Now appetite great_ tingling occasionally_ cloudy urine persists. Pulsations in ear very minimal and vertigo resolved. I have great energy_ work out 3X/week and have lost 25 pounds. I feel fabulous!

Tingliness in hands_ feet_ and face_ loss of appetite_ thirst (don't like drinking water but would drink lots of orange juice)_ little bit of diarrhoea_ nausea_ sleeping problems_ bad short term memory
Comments: Has really helped to reduce the swelling of my optic nerves might be able to get off the medication in 3-4 months at next appointment if all swelling is gone.

Side Effects: Fingers_ toes and lips tingle_ soda tastes awful_ appetite isnt the same as some foods taste different. My sleeping pattern is off_ I seem to have more restless nights. And really bad heart burn...its awful!
Comments: The ringing in my ear has stopped and I have had no headaches since taking the medicine. I was originally prescribed to take 2 pills a day but I didnt like the way it made me feel so I talked with my DR and they said one a day is fine.

Side Effects: EXTREME fatigue_ complete loss of libido_ myalgia_ tinnitus_ terrible short term memory.Haven't had any major headaches since starting Diamox and the chronic diahorrea has gone. Fatigue is so severe I can no longer work or drive a car. Numbness in whole calves and forearms and pain in chest is just the icing on the cake.

I have experienced the same as the pamphlet described about the tingling feet legs etc.  General fatigue (but then I'm a full time stay at home mom_ full time student and janitor evenings) so it's hard to say what causes the fatigue.However_ within 2 months on the medication my knees started aching_ and progressively have gotten so bad that getting up and down from a seated position is nearly impossible without support_ kicking anything is an absolute no as I feel my knee cap will pop out and I can't sit for too long without liftin my legs straight up to relieve the pain. Satisfied my edema is almost gone. Completely dissatisfied and terrified the damage on my knees may be permanent. I used to run marathon. I'm heart broken. I'd love suggestions_ as I'm not sure what my options are.
tingling in hands_ feet_ lips_ eyes hurt
Comments: Headaches finally going away_ Opening pressure was 330 on my spinal tap so they drained some fluid to bring the level back down_ eyes hurt but I see a Neuro Opthamologist  Overall after a couple weeks my headaches are not nearly as often or extreme..I am not overweight at all so they are testing me for Sarcoidosis  to make sure its not that instead of pseudotumor cerebri

Side Effects: Initial: dehydration_ frequent urination_ cloudy urine_ insomnia_ acid reflux_ taste changes_ cold sensitivity_ tingling in hands and feet_ appetite lossLong-term: cognitive issues_ face pains_ fatigue_ joint pain and stiffness_ unusual sensations_ dizziness
Comments: Initially this drug brought no relief and many bad side effects. I had trouble concentrating in school and slept through most of the day. Then_ after about 8 months_ I began to adjust to it and notice fewer symptoms_ and my papilledema all but disappeared along with my high pressure headaches. I still have other unexplained neuro issues_ but this drug has done what it's supposed to. The side effects can be intolerable in the beginning_ but if you stay hydrated and give yourself time to adjust_ you may find some relief.

Side Effects: Lately_ I've experienced fatigue_ drops in blood sugar and hair loss.
Comments: Diamox is also prescribed for glaucoma but I've developed glaucoma in both eyes although I've been on Diamox for 12 years for high intercranial pressures.  I've had surgery for (3) CSF leaks over the last 10 years.

Side Effects: Really bad tingling in hands feet and knees bad tension between my eyes I have Intracranial hypertension my pressure was 42 brought back down to 15 a week and half later went back upto 39 been put back down to 18 taking 250mg 4 times a day hoping will work currently having really bad head aches loss if weigh very thirsty fingers cross this medication will help
I have only got memory loss_ I don't get any tingling but do have trouble sleeping. And I take 1 x 250mg 4 times a day

Bp dropped suddenly to 90/80 without warning. Couldn't move or speak for 5 days. Bp seems ok now_ but constant nausea and diarreah. Was good for headaches but I am miserable and weak now . Dr still hasn't called me back yet. probably will change neuros.
I cannot sleep_ neck and EXTREME back pain_ tingling in fingers_ numbness in face_ slight blurry vision_ very shaky_ I can't concentrate on many things_ sick feeling.
tingling in hands_ feet and head. loss of appetite. Some lethargy when starting the medication.
Comments: I also had a tremor in my hands but I was also taking prednisone concurrently and would attribute that side effect to the prednisone. I found I was hit quite hard with the side effects of both medications at once including from the prednisone insomnia. I lost a few kilos but it didn't concern me and could also be attributed to the large amounts of water I was drinking. Although the side effects od Diamox are quite significant I found that drinking as much water as I physically could really made a difference to the severity of side effects. I don't drink soft drinks so I didn't have a concern with changing taste in regard to my other food. I would highly recommend just drinking as much as you can at strategic times when you're near a loo! I would get up to about 6L most days but I discussed privately with my boss that I wasn't 'slacking off' in regard to my frequent toilet breaks and she was quite understanding and discrete. When I was able to drink mass amounts of water I found I handled the meds quite well. The medication has done all it was prescribed to do. My optic discs have reduced as much as they are going to and I will be coming off the drugs in about 2months. I was able to avoid having a shunt surgically put in and neuro surgery so I don't feel I can complain as it saved my eyesight! There has been a delay in my husband and I being able to start a family_ we wanted to stay on the side of caution for the sake of the babies health_ at the end of the day I prefer eye si

Side Effects: Tingling in fingers_ feet_ lips_ elbows_ & knees. Loss of appetite_ fatigue_ difficulty concentrating. metallic taste to some foods. Cold air/water/food_ etc makes all of the tingling areas tingle more. Especially cold food_ the lip tingling gets pretty bad. Forgetfulness & trouble sleeping. It's important to drink plenty of fluids and get a good nights rest. A multivitamin may be helpful for those who have appetite loss; make sure you get all your nutrients. The symptoms are really intense the 1st couple of weeks and they do somewhat improve as you continue taking the drug.

I have to lay down for 4 hours after taking if I stand up my head hurts so bad and tingling in my heals. My opening pressure was over 40 and I have a 8 week old baby so I know I have to take them I've been told loads of water will help amazing amounts I will.not give up
Some tingling in hands and heels and my upper lip area.  Slight confusion - not so easy to concentrate and a bit forgetful.
Comments: After reading all of the comments on this drug_ I was afraid to take it.  But so far_ so good.  These are side-effects I can live with.  My appetite has decreased and I still have enough energy to workout twice a day.  Losing weight is a huge factor in recovery_ and I'm determined to do it.  I'm not letting the Diamox take me down.

Side Effects: Tingling in hands_feet_elbows...stiffness in knees_tired_thirsty_mind fog_stuttering_cold alot more than before_diarrhea...however it has helped with headaches & pressure

Tingling in hands and feet_ dizziness_ require more sleep at night_ carbonation tastes like liquid fire in mouth and throat_ heartburn_ hard time get thoughts out into words_ dry mouth_ stomach ache_ lips tingle_ sensitivity to sunlight_ legs feel like I ran 5 miles_ ringing in one ear_
Numbness in hands and feet nausea vomitting blurred vision headaches....ect
Intermittent tingling in fingertips and bottom of feet the very first day
Comments: At over 8000 feet of altitude_ I had no symptoms of altitude mountain sickness at all_ which I have always been afflicted with.

Side Effects: Metallic taste_ tingling in feet_ napping is absolute must have now_ slurring my speech_ feel dizzy and uncoordinated.

So far I am extremely tired_ soda tastes weird_ Concentrating on one thing is impossible. Tingling in hands and feet_ spider web feeling on the face_ stomach pain_ dehydrated_ TIRED_ Loud ringing in ears_ thirsty
INCREDIBLY lethargic.  Foggy brain_ memory loss_ nausea_ tingling in the fingers and toes.  Metallic taste with carbonated drinks and beer.  Weight loss_ loss of appetite.
Comments: At first the diamox was a wonder drug_ meaning my headaches and the pressure in my head subsided. Then_ I slowly began feeling horrible.  Headaches would return. Lack of energy_   I developed swollen fatty knots under my skin.  Found out that it was because of the diamox.  I have been off of this drug for two weeks and I feel like my life has changed. The knots have decreased in size. People instantly see me and notice a shine skin and and all together better well being.  This is a TERRIBLE drug and I am so thankful that I am off of it.

Side Effects: I am on 1000mg per day and the side effects have been pretty status quo compared to what I've read on this board. That is: tingling in hands and feet_ nausea_ loss of appetite_ some hair loss_ foggy brain and difficulty remembering things. The most severe symptoms for me were the weakness_ body aches and complete lack of energy.
Comments: I hope that this information can help someone else the way it has helped me. I went to my general practitioner and asked her if she knew of any ways to manage the symptoms so that I could function and not fall behind in my program (I am a phD candidate and am supposed to be working on my dissertation and graduating in the next year-I can't afford to not function). She told me that my symptoms were most likely due to dehydration (I had been drinking about 80oz a day). She increased me to 4 liters! It is A LOT OF WATER_ but by the next morning I felt better. I have energy again and I don't hurt. My hair has also stopped falling out. I still have tingles_ but they're annoying more than debilitating. She said a good test to determine if you are where you need to be hydration-wise (especially with this drug)_ is to continue increasing water intake until your urine is no longer yellow-but clear.   My neurologist just put me on lacix as well_ so I am most likely going to have to drink more_ and watch electrolytes. Anyhow_ I knew that I would have to increase my water intake because this drug was a diuretic_ but I had NO idea as to how much. I needed to share though because it really has made all of the difference in the world!

Side Effects: ringing in ears (all day)_ numbness in fingers (sometimes painful)_ knee pain_ tired_ brain fog_ daily diarrhea_ loss of appetite_ anything carbonated tastes like steel_ weight loss_ acidosis
Comments: I started with 500 MG daily and was taken up to 2_750 MG and got very sick with metabolic acidosis because of diamox.  I'm back to 1_500 - 2_000 MG a day with better results.  It takes 6 weeks to get used to this med and the ringing ears and diarrhea is probably the worse part for me.  The positive is that it does reduce the head pressure and makes it possible for me to work and function. I'm still waiting to see my eyes get better though.  I am not overweight but have lost 20 pounds while on this because I never feel hungry.

Side Effects: The usual with tingling_brain fog_feeling the cold alot more than normal_stomach acid_pains in the legs_heart palpalations but worst of all Kidney Stones now 4 times in 5 years be aware that even drinking loads of water you stand a good chance of getting them!
Comments: I have been off and on Diamox many times as I keep getting kidney stones_every time I start back on them I get the usual tingling and feeling like I'm a dumb ass all over again_I have also had to change my job to an indoor one as the fatigue was just too much for me_as for helping with the headaches they actually make them worse at first_if you can put up with all the horrible side effects when you start taking these and believe me you will want to stop_ then eventually your body kind of gets use to it_only for you to start with horrible leg cramps and feeling cold when you go to bed and sometimes can't get to sleep which makes your headache even more and so the circle of shite continues until you either give up on them or get a shunt.The only thing that this drug did for me was make me a stronger willed person

Side Effects: Intermittent tingling in hands_ mouth and feet. Cloudy urine_ but no increase in urination even though I have increased my water intake. Lack of appetite. Can't drink anything carbonated. Very tired. Hard to find words sometimes. Seems like I stutter more than before. Cold all the time now.
Comments: When I had my first LP I was at a pressure of 43. I was drained down to 20_ then four days later was back up to 27 even after being on Diamox 500 mg/day for four days. Drained again to 14_ then ended up with a spinal headache. Had a blood patch done_ where they placed 20 cc of my own blood in the epidural space. Spinal headache gone. Now up to 250mg 4x/day. Both of my optic nerves have hemorrhaged and I have lost some of my color vision. Severe eye pain and pressure and headache are for the most part gone now. Hoping that this medicine works so that I don't have to have surgery.

Side Effects: Tingling/pins and needles in fingers and toes and occasionally face (sometimes very painful)_ frequent urination_ "mind fog"_ depression_ headache_ severe fatigue_ change in taste of carbonated beverages.
Comments: Almost all of the side effects go away if you drink lots of water! Also_ as you get used to the medication it gets much better (it just takes a few weeks to adjust). It works! My CSF pressure went down and optic nerve swelling decreased. However_ every 2 months or so my IIH symptoms (visual problems and headache) come back and they need to adjust the dosage. I am trying to be optimistic that they will find a dosage that works for me_ and combined with weight loss my IIH will go away. Don't assume the worst with this drug! At first it seems absolutely awful but it works and the side effects go away.

Side Effects: Severe pins and needles numbness in hands and feet  lower back pain dizziness incresed thirst

tinging in hands_ pressure/tingling in nose/tongue/head/neck/shoulders/back/feet.  lack of appetite. lack of sense of thirst.  cloudy urine.  confusion.  drowsiness.  numbness.  lack of hand coordination.  depression.
Comments: this is horrible stuff.  i feel sicker than ever.  doctors are unconcerned with side effects_ though every website i see says to report tingling of extremities IMMEDIATELY_ as it is counted as a SEVERE reaction.  i feel horrible_ and all i can do is lay down.  i've been sick for over a year_ and the doctor just gave this to me as an experiment.

Side Effects: Tingling in hands_ feey and around mouth.  Heartburn_ fatigue_ brain fogginess_ metalic taste when drinking carbonated beverages_ intolerance to cold_ burp up sulfer taste and loss of appetite.

Tingly in hands_ feet and face. Tired. Hard to grasp words_ lost some weight.  I was diagnose with pseudo tumor celibri 6 years ago. I was not able to move from my bed due to the extreme headache. They were so bad that I would have blackouts. I started taking this drug and slowly I stopes having pain_ lost weight_ pressure in my head and optic nevlrve decrese. I would take up to 4000mg a day with topamax. Now I only take 750mg and thank GOD_ no pain. It gets better! Believe it! I am proof of it!!!!!!

Fatigue_ Confused_ Disoriented_ Weak_ Stomach pain_ Tingling in hands_ feet_ knees and spider web feeling on face. Memory problems & concentration problems; Dizziness;  Diarrhea_ Taste changes_ I am always freezing even when it was 90 degrees this summer_ some vision changes
Comments: After running mri's_ every test you can think of and 62 blood tests they finally diagnosed me with PTC In Jan 2011. LP was 25 took me down to 17 then i had another in Nov it was 25-29 took me down to 17 ugh not sure what good the meds are doing if its not lowering my pressures but it sure is helping with some of the headaches!!  My neurologist tried me on topamax and I had an allergic reaction so she put me on Diamox_ had an allergic reaction then my husband was researching and found that the cause of my reaction was cause of how fast they upped my dosage. So I started over and am up to 4000mg a day. Its helped alot till the seasons changed and now the headaches are back full force. Sometimes I wonder why I go without my Diet Pepsi so Ill go without and have me a soda and I rememeber quick enough!! The side effects suck but even with the weather changes here what the diamox is controlling is so much better than what it could be!!

Side Effects: Extreme body pains?!...very weak and tired. Slow to think. worse headaches. Vision more blurry! Is this normal?! Im not overweight. My pressure was 19 on my LP but my papilledema continues to worsen. :( very frightened.
Severe tingling in hands and feet_ tiredness_ soda tasted really weird_ things looked weird
Comments: My first neurologist gave me a small dosage_ when I visited my neuroptomologist from John Hopkins_ he told me that the dosage wasn't enough to do anything_ so he raised my dosage 4x. I recently was taken off the medicine

Side Effects: Tired_ Sleepy_ Confused_ Disoriented_ Weak_ Stomach pain_ Tingling in fingers and feet.
Comments: I get so fustrated that I stop taking it some times. I am the sole provider and care taker of me. I cant afford to be all of those things. But I also cant afford not to see. I get so scared sometimes and my friends cant understand when I explain what I am going thru because I look fine.

Side Effects: Tingling in hands_ feet_ knees and spider web feeling on face. Decreased appetite. Dry itchy skin. Dry mouth_ sometimes get confused.
Comments: I was diagnosed with IIH Sept 8 2011. It was nice to actually put a name to the "thing" that was causing issues in my daily life. I was waking up in the morning completely blind and it would last for about 30-45 seconds. I brought this to my doctor's attention and he sent me to an Opthalmoloist. From there I was seen by my neurologist who ordered the LP. I have had only 1 LP with an opening pressure of 32 that when we were done taking off a few tubes of fluid for testing went down to 12. Since the LP I have felt that my head doesn't feel as "full" as it was before and I am no longer waking up blind. It take a few seconds for my eyes to adjust_ but I can see. I was started on the Diamox just after the LP and to me it seems that it is working. I am VERY thankful even with all the side effect for this drug. It was terrifying to me to think that I might not see my daughters grow up or to see my Husband return from his deployment next summer. There are so many FUTURE memories that this drug is going to help me see. I am so happy I came across this page it really helps to know others are having the same experiences I am. THANK YOU ALL!!! =)

Side Effects: Tingling in hands_ feet_ face_ arms_ and mouth; Memory problems & concentration problems; Dizziness; Vomiting; Diarrhea; Sharp stomach pains; Drowsiness; Change in taste.
Comments: Diamox helps a little for my PTC_ but the side effects happen 24/7. It almost makes me stop taking it until I realize just how much it's helping my head. So if you think you'll have a problem with constantly being really tired_ always having your hands or feet tingle_ being sore or dizzy all the time_ having an upset stomach_ or not being able to taste things right.. Don't take this. Although it really does help_ and so I don't mind the side effects TOO much.. Just know it'll make you feel pretty icky sometimes_ but just fight through it and you'll be fine.

Side Effects: the usual_ tingling in face and feet_ blurred vision at first but then improved vision_ bitter taste with carbonated beverages_ nasuea.
Comments: Started using using about five  years ago 250mg usually I would get relief in a few weeks.  Six months ago another episode was cured by the same dose_ but this time it didn't seem to work_ so I doubled the dose to 500mg 2X per day still no relief.  My symptoms are pressure and fluid probably CSF in my ears.  The pressure varies throughtout the day cannot correlate with anything_  I missed a dose last week and it felt like my head was going to explode.  Not sure what to do I definitely don't want to have a shunt too risky for infection_ so I'm waiting this one out.  I started with pseudo tumor when I was abour 20 and weighed about 120 lbs_ I certainly didn't fit the usual profile.  Had surgery to repair a CSF leak in my left ear in 91 it returned a few years later then faded away only to return again and again_  Now both ears are full.  Anyone have a similar experience?

Side Effects: Spider web feelings on my face_ arms and neck_ since using Diamox have been unable to drink carbonated drinks_ taste horrible_  skin dry and itchy; tingling in fingers and heels. I stay cold all the time_ even in the hottest temps.
Comments: My eye pressure has decreased back to nomal since taking Diamox_ But I can't wait to stop taking this drug_

Side Effects: i have noticed over the years weight gain_tired all the time_and numbness in face_tingling in hands and feet. also i had the shunt put in on nov. 6_2001.

Tingling in hands and feet (Paraesthesia)_ "Spider web" sensation on face_ Taste alterations (Parageusia)_ Low blood pressure_ Loss of Appetite_ Dizziness_ Fatigue_ Short term memory loss_ Confusion_ Headaches
Comments: Went into the ER with vision loss_ severe headache_ and dizziness after visiting my Neuro-ophthalmologist who found Optic Nerve Swelling (Papilledema). After an MRI_ Cranial CT Scan_ and an Angiogram the possibility of a brain tumor or Epidural/Subdural Hematoma were ruled out. I had an LP_ and pressure of 62ppm was dropped to 32 ppm. Four days later I had another LP to drop my pressure from 32ppm to 12ppm. I was put on the Diamox and Naproxen. I have had 4 more LP's since I was diagnose with IIH 3 months ago. The side effects are sometimes unbearable_ but it's slowly starting to work. My doctor told me to give it 3 to 4 months to allow the medicine to start working properly. And so far my pressure has gone down slowly with each LP i have had. I have lost 35 pounds_ and have since then gone off birth control since those are two very harmful factors when dealing with IIH. Take magnesium supplements_ and eat lots of potassium (that will help with the tingling)_ drink PLENTY of fluids (since your peeing everything out)_ and excercise. The more I do_ the more energized I feel... If you're willing to give it a chance_ and it's working for you_ STICK WITH IT! It's better than the alternative (Cerebral Shunt). I am still having LP's done on a fairly regular basis... But all in all I am counting my blessings.

Side Effects: I experienced bad side effect (foggy brain_ metabolic acidosis_ tingling in tips of fingers and feet_ carbonated drink bad taste_ fatigue worst than tha simptoms of IIH) so I decided it was not the drug for me.
tingling in tips of fingers and feet. also some tingling on lips and tongue. fatigue.
Comments: I started taking Diamox when I was having severe headaches. Saw neurologist after seeing my regular doc 3x. Had LP 2 days after seeing neurologist. My pressure was at 43 and had 14cc of fluid removed. Having another LP and possibly a 3rd. Increased my Diamox from 1x a day at 250mg to 2x a day at 250mg. Had double vision for over a month and it is now starting to go away after taking diamox 2x a day.

Side Effects: At first there was tingling in the toes and fingers_ Spider-web feeling on my lips_ frequent bathroom visits_ loss of sex drive_ carbinated drinks and chocolate have a metalic taste_ dry mouth
Comments: My optical nerves were swelled at 4+ and my vision was almost gone. It would completely go for about 30 sec or so when I would stand or move my head fast. I had major blind spots in both eyes and the rest of my field of vision was blurry_ so bad to the point I couldn't drive anymore. And headaches... the worst ever! But I have always had headaches.  Went to my eye doctor and he determined thats probably what it was. Sent me to a neurologist. She done a spinal tap and my back pressure was at 42. They drained it down to 15 and started me on Diamox the same day. This was 45 days ago. I have visited my dr.'s since then and my optical nerves have still been swollen to 4+. My neurologist has increased Diamox by 1/250mg pill every week to where now I am on 7 a day. 2 days ago I went back to my eye dr. and my optical nerve swelling is at 1. He says this is an indication that my back pressure is going down as well. I am dieting and currently have lost 13 lbs. The hardest part is not being able to drink dt. dr. pepper_ but then this may be a good thing to as soda makes you retain water!!! The other symptoms are nothing I can't deal with in order to be able to see my children grow up. THANKS DIAMOX!!!

Side Effects: Tingling lips and fingers_ bad heartburn_ nauseau_ very sleepy
Comments: This medicine has significantly reduced the pressure in my eyes (originally in 200 range) now my left eye is near normal levels and my right eye is getting there. My headaches are starting to return but I am not sure if it is allergy related.

Side Effects: Dryness under nose_ dry skin_ very strong heartburn_ feeling of "not fully being there"_ fatigue_ brain fog_ "spacing out"_ carbonated sodas suddenly tasting disgusting_ increased urination
Comments: On it for IIH_ prescribed by Neuro Opthamologist. Side effects are piling on but there doesn't seem to be another choice for me. I'm hoping to be able to finish my semester at college. Does help my IIH headaches_ only get mild headaches about 1-2 times a day. vision got better but hasn't for a few days_ crossing my fingers on that.

Side Effects: Tingling in hands_ feet_ leg cramps_ nausia_ appitite loss_ unable to drink carbonated drinks
Comments: I have been taking this on and off for 2 years. I am not over weight and the doctors have no idea why this is happening_ and yet they still tell me to lose weight. I weigh 145 lbs and I am 5 foot 7 inches. When taking the diamox like I am supposed to it makes me tired_ and I lose my ambition. My condition has gotten better_ but as soon as I take a lower dose or not take it at all_ my migraines come back. It is like a lose lose situation.

Side Effects: Pins and needles in hands and feet_ occasional stabbing pains in legs_ slightly light headed_ severe fatigue for the first few days.
Comments: I started taking the generic for the pseudo tumor cerebri a few months ago then lost my insurance. I was on it just long enough to get up to the 1000mg a day and past the extreme fatigue. In myself_ the fatigue went for about 2 weeks then once I started losing the weight I got some energy back. Had to make a complete diet change to aid weight loss. Now have some financial assistance so back on the generic diamox. It was starting to work for me so I'm hoping to get that back. It seems to be a 50/50 chance that it will work for someone_ everyone's body chemistry is different. For me this is the only thing standing between me and surgery. LPs are out of the question_ the first (and only) one that I had put me in the ER 4 times with the worst migraine I have ever had. Getting past the initial side effects is my big challenge but I'm down 60lbs with 55lbs to go and I think this will work for me... I hope!One important thing to remember is that Diamox (and generic) destroys electrolites so you need to be replacing them. I've found that making a drink that's about 70% pedialyte and 30% ginger ale makes it easiest to get them back. Also I am prone to kidney stones_ and diamox can produce them even in people who've never had one so hitting my 4 liter a day limit on water is super important.

Side Effects: Blurred or foggy vision_ dry mouth_ tingling in extremedies_ loss of apetite_soda and other drinks taste strange_fatigued_ loss of memory_ sex drive gone.
Comments: I dont know if glaucoma is a side effect of the Pseudutomor cerebri but the both presented themselves around the same time. I've gone from being super active to a couch potatoe_ when diagnosed to weighted 254lbs my last weight in was 232lbs. purely from loss of apetite I'm so tired I can barely get my mail.

Side Effects: Tingling and numbing in feet_ hands (most finger tips)_ spine_ lips; increased urination_ drowsiness (especially for the first few days after a dosage increase)_ foggy thoughts (usually only after a dosage increase)

Tingling in hands_ feet_ only sometimes. I'm a runner and have experienced muscle fatigue. All in all_ mind over matter plays a big part in this drug. Don't let it win! You have to be in control and not let it control you.
Comments: I am a "different" sort of case_ my doctors would say. I am 4'11 and 110 lbs. Before taking the drug I had a spinal tap to reduce my pressure and weighed 115 WITH muscle. After taking I don't have as much energy to run_ but am starting to get back into it. I've noticed if I remember to take the medicine at the same time each day my body and mind react better to it. I have just began to really get used to it. Instead of running 3-5 miles per day_ like I used to_ I have resently started a new routine to help with seasonal blues and not being able to do as much. I walk .5 miles on the treadmill (until sunnier weather)_ run 1 mile and walk .5 more. I recommend doing as much excersize as possible to increase your energy level! It helps with energy and mentality. No more excuses and complaining_ just do it :)

Side Effects: Tingling in hands and feet; aching in legs; heartburn_ nausea_ dizziness and afternoon drowsiness; decrease of headaches and appetite; increased volume of tinnitus...
Comments: LP relieved pressure of 28 ppm to 12 ppm - removed 4 cc's of CSF. Trying to drink 2 glasses of fluid with each dosage.  By cutting back sugar intake and sodium intake (approx. 1_500 mg a day) - have lost 10 lbs. in past three weeks_ with one lb a day since starting medication.  First three days_ only took half a pill to ease into side effects.

Side Effects: Tingling of the hands_ feet_ and face. Feet and hands stay cold all the time. Loss of appetite as well as no longer able to drink carbonated drinks. Insomnia_ with extreme fatigue. Loss of weight and frequent urination like a pregnant woman!
Comments: This medication is saving my life. I went from having seizures and being practically blind to being able to drive again and be seizure free. However_ I no longer feel like doing anything but laying on the couch. I have constant kidney pain and miss Dr. Pepper so bad...but it's for a good cause!!!

Side Effects: Paraesthesia (pins and needles)_ taste changes (especially to carbonated drinks)_ ++ fatigue_ dry mouth and eyes_ lowered insulin requirements/hypoglycemia (Type 1 Diabetes)_ sensitivity to the cold_ constipation.
Comments: Diamox has greatly improved my IIH symptoms. I rarely have pressure headaches (unless I forget to take a dose). And the papilloedema in my eyes has completely resolved. The intensity of the side-effects of Diamox has somewhat diminished the longer I have stayed on the medication. Pins and needles_ hypoglycemia_ constipation and sensitivity to the cold continue. The fatigue and dehydration were incredible when I first started on the medication. Whenever I "stopped" I'd fall asleep. It was nothing to 'nap' for 6 hours. I needed eye drops several times a day for lubrication. I've also lost weight (10kg/22lbs) despite eating more for the frequent hypoglycemic episodes.

Side Effects: When I first started taking Diamox at age 14_ and any time I've increased the dosage_ I got tingling in my face_ limbs_ and even "glutes"_ but nothing very serious. At 24_ I went off the drug for a couple of years_ and when I resumed_ I got the tingling and the cold plus indigestion_ irregularity_ trouble concentrating_ frequent "spacing out" spells_ crippling depression_ and chronic_ debilitating fatigue.
Comments: I have a love-hate relationship with Diamox. It is the only drug that has controlled my eye pressure_ but it makes me feel like a wrung-out dishrag. I am legally blind_ but it is thanks to mountains of Diamox and a few outstanding ophthalmologists that I am not totally blind. However_ as I have gotten older_ it seems the side effects have gotten worse. I've missed work_ appointments_ birthdays_ even my grandmother's funeral because I was just too exhausted. If I manage to run an errand or just stay up a full day_ I have to sleep 18-20 hours a day for the next few days to "recharge my battery". I've wanted to get off this stuff for years; I'm trying a new surgery next year. Diamox may be saving my sight_ but it's eating my life.

Side Effects: Severe abdominal cramping/bloating/pain. Heartburn. Mild tingling in feet_ hands and face. Significantly altered taste_ unable to taste carbonation in soda_ increased need for sleep_ metabolic acidosis_ decreased libido and significant weight loss.
Comments: During initial lumbar punctures_ hospitalization and diagnosis my headaches got much worse than before treatment. Headaches are now about once a week. Papilledema got much better_ first 3/4 in both eyes @hospital and now 1/4 and 2/4. In almost 5 months of being on Diamox I have lost 37lbs. Starting at 226lbs down to 189lbs. I try to eat easily digested foods because the few times I get hungry I have heartburn and cramp the next day. I need tons of sleep and yawn several times per hour. In my case_ ALL the side effects suck but I've tried and tried and never had enough motivation to loose weight. Being overweight is my only risk factor for Pseudotumor cerebri so loosing the weight could potentially cure me.

Side Effects: Tingling in heads and feet_ sometimes around my mouth.  Tired all the time.  Stupid_ forgetful and just not myself.  Dizzy and clumsy. Soreness in neck and shoulders.
Comments: I will deal with the side effects to save my vision....but I wish there was another way.  I can not function like this.  I am only a fraction of what I used to be.

Side Effects: Pins and needles feeling on bottoms of feet_ knees_ and mouth_ also in hands_ but that has been less frequent. It's not painful_ just annoying. Frequent heart burn. Ringing in ears. More frequent urination.
Comments: I have not had a migraine since I started this medication_ so it has helped in that reguard. Not sure if it has helpedwith my vision yet. The side effects are mostly just annoying. Acidic foods make the tingling  in the mouth worse.

Side Effects: nothing yet a bit of pins and needles in left foot
Comments: is it safe to drink with these tablets

Side Effects: Tingling in feet_ hands_ lips. Dizziness. Frequent urination. Loss of memory. Forgetfulness. Soda taste really bad.
Comments: I had spinal tap on July 30_2010. Pressure was mildly elevated. 2 weeks later went back to Nero and he put me on Diamox 500mg twice daily. So been on med for 7 days now. Hasen't inpressed me yet. I will give it some more time and hope it starts to help. Still have everyday pressure headaches and my ears really feel like alot of pressure in them.

Side Effects: Lack of sex drive. I used to want to have sex every day_ but about two weeks after I started having diamox my sex drive died.
Comments: My weight has remain the same which is a good thing. I still get a few headaches which can be quite bad. Epilepsy is better controlled. I believe there is something better to control it.

Side Effects: Tingling of extremeties_ mental sluggishness_ loss of appetite_ weight loss_ total loss of senses of smell and taste_ fatigue_ diminished memory_ fatigue_ urinary frequency.
Comments: Diamox stimulates respiration and has saved my life.  Loss of taste and smell is annoying_ but I'd rather breathe.

Side Effects: I had tingling in my hands_ feet_ and sometimes my face.  I feel exhausted all the time_ like I can't get enough sleep.  My headaches have improved as I only had one in the last 6 days and it's normally 5 or 6 a week that are completely debilitating.  My legs_ ankles and feet also feel "achy".
Comments: I will give it 6 weeks when I have a follow up with my Doctor.  If I am still feeling this way_ I think I will have to ask about alternatives to taking this med. I have been too tired to live my life like normal for the last week.

Side Effects: Tightness in chest_ very bad tempered_ loss of 'focus'_ abililty to concentrate.
Comments: I have IIH very mildly_ I havent really noticed any real change in my condition_ just side effects

Side Effects: tingling in hands_ feet_ face (hydrating REALLY helps with this) tiredness_ a little uncoordinated.
Comments: would suggest putting up with side effects as opposed to losing eyesight. diamox is very effective and not reported to cause any fatalities or such. I can see out of my left eye again.

Side Effects: tingling in feet and hands. somewhat foggy feeling_ sometimes low energy.
Comments: have had pseudo tumor for about 3 years.  When diagnosed_ began Diamox at 250 3x per day.  However_ as lost weight (40lbs)_ began to get low pressure headaches instead of high pressure and was able to get off meds.  Have gained weight again_ and pressure is increased and now back on 1/2 250 pill morning and 250mg at night.  Hopefully_ with weight loss_ can get off meds.  Weight loss is key to controlling this disease.

Side Effects: Tingling sensation in fingertips_toes and knees. It was more frequent when I started taking Diamox. It has reduced now. Fatigue and tiredness is always there and I feel sleepy always. I feel more thirsty and my mouth&lips are always dry. I lost 2-3 Kilos within a week of taking Diamox_ but weight's been pretty much same after that.I have just started taking Potassium supplement (Potassium Chloride solution). Diamox being a diuretic brings out the Potassium levels in the body.

I was diagnosed with pseudo tumor 3 years ago. At first I was taking the name brand diamox. I had no problems with it whatsoever. I didn't notice anything different. I was taking 500 twice a day I believe. The only side effect I had was tingling sensations at the bottom of my feet and sometimes my hands. But when I couldn't afford the name brand I had to switch to generic. The generic is terrible. It gave me really bad headaches 30 minutes after taking the meds. It also gave me weird vision. Not blurry_ but like just weird. Like my head was a balloon.
Comments: I am very sensitive to pressure changes and have a history of migraines. My trip to flagstaff made me very very ill and I though my head was going to explode. I get nauseous. But the diamox_ name brand_ helped that. I can travel. But without insurance_ diamox is way too expensive. My doctor took my off of it and we are playing by ear. Every since I switched to the generic_ the meds make me disoriented_ migraines_ and nauseous. But it is very serious. Not taking the meds can mess up your vision. I went from 20/15 to 20/25. My optic nerves are always swollen and I have a small blind spot in my left eye. The meds are important_ regardless of the side effect. I've been dealing with this for years. Please contact me if you need any advice. This medication takes time to adjust to.

Side Effects: Lots of tingling and numbness in my face hands and feet. I find it hard to focus due to so much fatigue.
Comments: The Diamox eventually helped. It took a week with pain medication and medication for naseau for the diamox to start relieving the pressure behind my eyes and down my back. Being through this twice I would recommened a Spinal Tab to relieve the initial pressure then diamox to maintain the pressure.

Side Effects: constant tingling in extremeties (either while laying still or repeated movement_ like scratching makes fingers tinlge)_ pressure headaches around eyes_ lower back pain_ knees/ankles/hips/shoulders hurt for no reason_ sodas tasted metallic but not anymore_ always tired_ acid reflux_ no energy_ loss of apetite
Comments: It doesn't seem to be helping_ but the decreased appetite has been helpful. The headaches are worse than when I started_ but are not as constant. Will try it a little while longer before making request for new treatment method.

Side Effects: Pins and needles in hands_ feet and lips. Lowered alertness. Insomnia alongside absolute pathetic energy levels. Drinking pop tastes like a liquid 9 volt battery on the tongue. Loss of apetite.
Comments: been on this 3 weeks now_ and from day 2 onward my visual symptoms have all but vanished. I still get some obscurations from time to time_ and i still feel my head and neck spine "balooning up" so thats good. Also this has ruined my hunger so hopefully that will help with that. The downside is ive got the good old pins and needles in my hands_ feet_ and lips. When i drink soda it feels like a liquid 9 volt battery being passed over my tongue. I have the most horrendous time sleeping_ which makes seeing my new battery of doctors ever more inconveniant. Even when i sleep well_ im forever drowsy and unmodivated. Sure beats spinal taps tho_ especially considering im heavy enough that it start resembling a "pin the tail on the donkey" game for the doctors to find the right spot...

Side Effects: When I started at 1000 mg I had the tingling and weird taste to pop_ but I am now up to 2000 mg and no longer have the side effects due to the medication no longer working for me and my fluid continuing to rise.
Comments: Very frequent urination now that I'm up to 2000 mg_ somewhat of an appetite loss_ the medication is only masking my signs and symptons_ it is no longer keeping the fluid level down even though I take it 4 times a day_ so in my view the medication is no longer working and it doesn't always cont. to work for everyone. I'm still have side effects to my vision. When I first found out I had this_ my pressure level was at a dangerous rate and I almost lost complete vision in my left eye...I'm going through the same thing all over again....does anyone know why my medication isn't doing the job???

Side Effects: Tingling in extremities_ extreme fatigue_ nothing too severe that I cannot handle it.  Only taking 500 mg/day though.  I really need to lose weight which my doctor says is the best way to relieve the pressure.  I see where other people have lost alot of weight but this medicine has not done that for me.  Why am I not losing weight like the others.  I still have my usual appetite but I am too tired to work out!  Help!
Comments: If you have any ideas on why I am not losing weight like many people have_ please email me.  Thanks!

Side Effects: Only side effects were pins and needles in hands and feet_ 24/7
Comments: Worked great for diplopia_ subsided after a week.

Side Effects: Numbness/tingling in fingers/toes_made it hard to walk.Facial swelling & numbness.Strange taste to food/drinks. Headaches worse.Overall I felt horrible and much worse then my PTC/IIH.
Comments: This medication did not work for me. Saying that I wouldn't recommend it would be silly...just because it didn't work for me doesn't mean it would not work for someone else. I simply want to let the people that can not take this drug (like me) know that there are options for them. There are other diuretics out there. I now use Lasix with no symptoms and have a lumbar puncture twice a year to take off excess fluid that the Lasix does not help with. There is hope_ you just need to talk to your Neurologist and see what works for you. If they tell you that you just have to live with the adverse reactions to a certain medication_ change physicians. You are your own advocate.

Side Effects: Tingling feet and hands_ extreme tiredness/sleeping a lot_ pop tastes like crap_ loss of appetite_ extreme thirst_ get cold easily_ and just a lot of general discomfort >.
Comments: I've only been taking Diamox for about a week_ but I can barely stand it... the side effects are probably just as bad as my PTC symptoms. But there's not much that can be done_ if I want to keep my vision_ suppose I'll just have to keep taking it. I usually sleep a lot_ but since I started taking this_ it's been absolutely ridiculous. All I can do is sleep and rest because I feel miserable most of the time. I really hope this medicine becomes more tolerable with time and begins to help_ otherwise I would just rather live with the PTC.

Side Effects: i have a psuedo tumer
Comments: after month and month of taking it i felt worse and worse so i refused to take it it was hard to pay attion in class sometime hard to even go to school i got psuedo tumer when i was 16 and that was the worst feeling i have ever gotten made my mouth numb couldnt use the restroom then when i could it was pain ful i would not recomend this medicine to my worst enemy

Side Effects: Very hard to get used to high dosage (2000 mg).Very dizzy and unstable feeling while walking around_ feel like I'm going to pass out_ blurry vision_ painful eyes_ extremely tired_ body pains_ eyes are very sensitive to light_ sensitive to sound and smells_ decreased appetite.
Comments: I'm having a really hard time getting used to this medication. I ave been home from the hospital for 2 weeks after having 3 spinal taps to remove the extra spinal fluid. I feel like an vegetable_ I can't move around the house_ I am very weak and very dizzy. I was told it takes some time to get used to the Diamox but this is nuts.

Side Effects: Upset stomach_ fixed this by taking my pill with milk. Really tired_ most nights I'm in bed by 8:30pm.  Sodas taste horrible(YUCK)!  Have noticed a decrease in my appetite.
Extreme tiredness_pins and needles in hands_feet and legs and sometimes face_depression and made me irratable at times.Also gave me kidney stones!
Comments: First few weeks were hellish_tired all the time and made me very down_after a while my body got use to Diamox_but after 6 months I got kidney stones which is a so called `minor` health risk when taking these tablets.Still on them though as they do keep the pressure down somewhat.

Side Effects: Pins and needles in legs_ feet_ hands_ face (legs and feet so severe it wakes me up at nights)_ severe nausea at first (passed after about 4 weeks)_ loss of appetite_ get tired easily_ really thirsty all the time. I haven't dared try drinking Coke or anything so I don't know if thats changed taste.
Comments: It took about 4 long_ headache filled weeks to start working_ but once it did it is doing a great job. My optic nerve swelling has reduced dramatically from diagnosis to now (2 months) and I should have no lasting loss of vision. The doctors were discussing a shunt in the first four weeks_ but I am willing to put up with the side effects forever if it means an alternative to shunting. I was on 1500 mg per day for 4 weeks_ and then got increased to 2000 mg per day which I am still on.

Side Effects: Hands and feet fall asleep very easily_ anything carbonated tastes off_ soda tastes horrible_ Drowsiness but only for the first half hour after taking the drug.  Has reduced pressure.  Taking 500mg per day.
tingling everywhere_ hair loss but no bald spots_ memory issues_ lack of energy_ major weight loss_ nausea_ funny taste in mouth
Comments: It doesn't have the best side effects in the world but when you are dealing with IH this is about all you can do.  It has helped so much...very little pappilledema now but still have IH.

Side Effects: Tingling all over_ especially in my hands and feet when I am cold.  Also pins and needles from just sitting still_ it can be painful and it doesn't subside from shaking it off. I get very dizzy if I bend down_ and it regularly leads to feeling nauseous.  Everything carbonated tastes gross (which may not really be a bad thing).  As I started taking it and every time the dose got increased I was exhausted for at least a week while my body adjusted_ I was sleeping all the time.
Comments: I take 2000 mg a day plus digoxin and lisinopril to deal with the PTC/IIH - which is a whole lot of medication BUT I was practically blind when I was diagnosed and now all my symptoms have pretty much gone away.  My optic nerves are still slightly swollen_ so it's still there_ but under control.  So all in all I guess I'd rather deal with these side effects than go blind.  I wish there was something available to ease the side effects...I've also lost about 55 lbs and am still going...though it doesn't seem to have lessened the build up of CSF_ like the doctors and websites have suggested.

Side Effects: pins and needles_ 24/7 _nausea _ blured vision__ loss of appitite _tied _sometimes spaced out
Comments: have been taking for 2 years for iih .i think the side affects of the tablets are worse than the illness itself but it seems to be helping my eyesight

Side Effects: No side effects yet_ but we were told to drink lots and eat one banana a day...
Comments: This drug has given my Daughter SO MUCH HELP! We are on day 6 and she has not had ONE episode! She is able to stay up late_ without her eyes tiring or getting sick. She is also clearer (as opposed to the normal "brain fog") and I see her speech is MUCH clearer! GREAT DRUG!

Side Effects: Tingling in lips and occassional entire body chill that ripples through me. I still have the bad headaches_ it hasn't helped too much. I'm on 2000mg now and even that isn't working. I'm considering gastric bypass (psuedotumor is now a pre-req on some insurances!) to lose the weight and hopefully cure this horrible issue that I've dealt with for the past 7 years. This is my second comeback!
Comments: I also notice that I'm slow with comebacks (not a good thing for a blonde!)

Side Effects: tingly and numbness in hands and feet. Dizziness_ can't handle a rocking motion_ anxiety attacks (which I have never had before) Lost for words most of the time. Pains in the back_ neck_ knees and ancles which has caused me to get pain meds.
Comments: diamox has not helped my pressure all that much_ it worked at first but my pressure keeps going up and down causing a lot of pain.

Side Effects: Can't drink much of anything.. It all tastes bitter_ even water Have had a seziure from loss of sodium.  I urinate like I'm pregnant.  Cold feet if they aren't tingly.   I can't feel my left pinky most of the time.

This medicine makes my knees hurt so bad it feels like they are broke. My feet tingle like im walking on broken glass. I never knew a med could hurt this bad. Now i take pain med to deal with the knee thing. I do absolutly nothing anymore.
Comments: But hey it took the swelling out. So atleast my eyes wont go bad even though i feel like im 90 years old

Side Effects: tingling in hands and feet_ weight loss of @ 5 pounds_ carbonated drinks tasted funny first few months_ maybe caused some brain fog
Comments: Anyone with periodic paralysis should definitely try this drug...it will probably help you.

Side Effects: Tingling in hands_feet dry mouth_ bruising. The plus side of taking this medication is that I dont drink pop anymore makes it taste terrible and have not had any for a year now. That's how long I have been on the medication. It has helped the pressure and swelling has gone down alot. I have had the goldmens field vision tests done three times last year. And scheduled for another one in March this year. I still have floaters in my eyes. The headaches are gone somedays I have bad cordination. Dizzy spells once in awhile. I went from 164 lbs down to 115 lbs. I eat but get full fast the weight loss was being moniterd by my neurologist who said that I had to lose the weight so that it would be easier to treat the Pseudo-Tumor Cerebri. I wonder if that was one of the factors of why I had gained weight because of having the Pseudo-Tumor I'am only 5'4 and had always been small. I also will be having another lumbar puncture to check the pressure again to see if that has gotten back to normal_ T
Comments: Diamox has kept me from getting a shunt put in. And has helped with improving me from this diagnosis. It has its upsides and downsides to it like everything else

Side Effects: Very bad tingling in hands_ feet_ lip_ eyes lids... Increased urnination_ anything carbonated tastes metalic-like...You know when you are cold and shake and your chin shivers_ I get that randomly all the time at any point in the day. I have had a perios for the whole duration of taking this medicine. (3 weeks and 2 days) Decreased hunger_ I have lost 14 pounds in 3 weeks though (1700  or less calories a day)...
Comments: I like diamox because I have no more blurred vision_ black spots in visions_ no bright lights in visions. I have not had a head ache since the spinal tap leak. My optic nerve is still swollen_ so he up'ed my dose from 1000 mg a day to 2000 mg a day.

Side Effects: Random tingling in feet_ hands_ arms_ side of my face ("limb falling asleep feeling")_ Cokes have a metallic after-taste_ tired and sleepy at times
Comments: I take 2 grams a day (2000 mg - that's 8 pills)_ and it initally helped rid me of the headaches from PTC_ I still have double vision (which this is supposed to help)_ but it help to save my vision_ the headaches are returning though_ possibly due to a tolerance to the drug - its information packet from the pharmacy stated that it may begin to lose its affectiveness after long periods of use - short-term_ its worth it_ if you don't mind your feet and hands randomly falling asleep.

Side Effects: 1ST TWO WEEKS:  Tingling in feet/hands/lips (this actually started w/in an hour of taking 1st dose)_ carbonated bevs tast like rust_ MAJOR fatigue (could hardly work for about 6-7 days - slept ALL the time).
Comments: NOW:  Noticeable difference in cognitive thinking and continuous speech (I do presentations to groups all day for a living and this has really slowed me down -- consistently I forget my train of thought or forget words_ even if I had already done the same presentation 3 times earlier that day) - Also_ continued tingling (especially when in cold places)_ carbonated drinks still taste bad_ but fatigue is COMPLETELY gone.... I felt back to my usual energy levels in almost exactly 2 weeks.  My Neuro is going to take me off of this and put me on Topamax which has some similar_ but more intense_ side effects..... ANY suggestions?

Side Effects: Extreme fatigue_ loss of appetite_ confusion_ increased urination_ increased thirst_ depression.
Comments: Have been taking 2 500mg caps for three weeks. Have taken it in the past for months at a time.

Side Effects: slight tingling in finger tips and i broke out w/ acne on my neck_ chest and back. Sometimes it hurts.
Comments: I take it 3 times a day_ 250mg. It never really helped me. I had to have a shunt put into my lower back to drain the extra spinal fluid. I was almost blind. Now it keeps everything under control. But i still can't see that great. I still take the diamox but i'm so glad I have the shunt. I feel so much better.

Side Effects: severe nausea
Comments: I'am taking 4000 grams_I think at this high of a dosage it should be doing more for me than what it is.

Side Effects: Great drop in mental ability...less quick with words and reaction times...way too frequent urination...tingling fingers and toes...waking up at night because foot had fallen asleep and hurt so much...lowered Potassium levels...exhaustion...dizziness_ uncoordination_ foggy feelings...DO NOT COMBINE WITH ALCOHOL.
Comments: Drug lost it's effectiveness or I built up tolerance was taking 1000 mg - 2000mg daily before failed shunt surgery...now back up to 1500 and trying to get down in dose. This drug scares me.

Side Effects: tingling in hands and feet for first couple of months. Unable to drink caffinated beverages because the medication made them taste terrible...but hey_ that's not always a bad thing.
Comments: My headaches are almost completely gone and I feel like I have more energy. I love the way I feel now!

Side Effects: Weight loss_ tired at first_ tingly fingers and toes_ carbonated beverages taste horrible_ milk really helps with an upset stomach while taking Diamox.  My headaches have been gone for almost 4 months out of the 4 1/2 taking the medication.

The first weekend was absolutely horrible. I first took it on Thursday evening_ and by Friday afternoon I was flat in bed with a nasty pressure headache_ and spent the whole weekend there. It took me about two weeks to "mostly" adjust to it- I slept constantly and barely managed to make it through work. The remained of the 7 months were a great improvement over that  first couple of weeks_ and my sleeping patterns were close to normal again by month 3. After that first weekend_ I have not had a pressure headache since_ the dizzyness went away_ and the "black spots" in my vision went away completely. Carbonated drinks were metallic-tasting_ which is apparently par for the course_ and irritating_ but not really important.
Comments: I almost didn't manage to stick with it through that first couple of weeks_ but I'm very glad I just hung in there. Symptoms have yet to reoccur_ though my optic nerve once again shows enlargement. (This is two years later.) If I find myself all the way out of remission_ I'll not hesitate to take this medication again.

Side Effects: Tingly feeling in arms_ legs_ feet_ and lips; Always thirsty; Carbonated drinks taste weird; Double vision; Ringing in ears; Hearing loss in left ear; Uncoordinated
Comments: I also have MS and before taking Diamox I have never experienced any MS related symptoms. Now that I am_ after taking Diamox_ I tried to blame it all on my MS... but after reading that there's others who are experiencing the same side effects_ I reliazed it's been this medication! I am stopping Diamox tonight. I have been taking 250mg twice a day.

Side Effects: pop tastes wierd_ heart burn _ feel alittle "out there" at times
Comments: I just started tx with 1/2 pill in am and will graduate to 2 a day.  Hopefully I can get relief of my headaches.

Side Effects: Slight and occasional tingling in my arms/fingers but no otherside-effects.
Comments: Took to keep my urine pH alkaline during the night. Nephrologisttook me off after he said it might cause Calcium-phosphate stones

Side Effects: Tingling in feet_ hands and face_ carbonated beverages taste metallic_ slight fatigue.
Comments: Has stopped progession of the IIH symptoms. Will be doubling dose to decrease intracranial pressure.

Side Effects: tingling hands_ feet_ lips; ringing in ears; blurred vision; slight overall tremor.
little rash
Comments: this simple drug gave me a much better quality of life. I went from 2-3 episodes of ataxia a day to less than 1 a month

Side Effects: marked paresthesias (tingling) in hands and feet
Comments: Take only 125 mg twice a day (most tablets are 250 mg) for first 24-36 hours or so at high altitude to prevent side effects; stop if tingling occurs or it will increase!

Side Effects: Diuretic effect initially. Tingling in extremities at high doses_ especially as response to pressure. Altered taste of carbonated beverages.
Comments: The body adjusts to this medication_ and the diuretic effect diminishes in a few days. The medication helps very slowly. Dosage is gradually increased. Improvment is not a steady process but it is fluctuating. Best efficacy is when taken on an empty stomach_ about an hour before meal.

Side Effects: I can only eat small amounts at a time now..very tingly all over esp. face_ hands_ knees_ feet..feel tired and dizzy all the time
Comments: Only been taking for 1 month so far. Just not myself.  Although aches are gone and eye pain is better_ I am on a permamnent "high"..very hit and miss.  sometimes i feel its working and then I think it's not.

Side Effects: Initially_ tingling in feet and hands.  Metallic taste with any carbonated beverages for first 18 month of treatment. After that_ carbonated beverages taste fine again.  Very fatiqued and not as mentally sharp as prior to taking Diamox.  Have developed daily heartburn and am wondering if this is also related to the Diamox.
Comments: Currently take 1500 mgs (three 500mg Sequels) daily.  Although some symptoms have disappeared (tinnitus_ internal pounding in skull)_ my eyesight continues to decline.

Side Effects: Very tired_ coordination is off_ bad taste with soda_ tingling in toes_ just not myself_ VERY off colour.
Comments: My headaches have gotten worse_ no sign of it helping me at all.

Side Effects: tingling hands and feet_ soda's and some foods taste different_ some sleepiness.
Comments: weight loss when first started taking.

Side Effects: tingling_ always thirsty feeling_ dryness_
tingling in hands and feet_ bad tasting sodas_ boughts of sleepyness_ and extreme heartburn.
Tingling in extremities (no biggie); dryness_ esp. hair; odd taste with carbonated soda.
Comments: Helped reduce spinal pressure; pain reduction noticed.  Side effects minor overall.

Side Effects: some tingling in the hands and feet
Comments: This drug quickly helped reduced the swelling in my eye_ restoring my eyesight and eliminating headaches.
